result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph W Polack was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 176 days only if revoked.

miscConds.notes: The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with all recommendations.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
Defendant must undergo a psychological evaluation and follow thru with all recommendations - appointment to be setup within the first 90 days of probation.

The defendant must undergo an anger management assessment and follow thru with all recommendations - to be completed within the first 6 months.

The defendant must take all medications as prescribed and in the manner in which they are prescribed.

The defendant must submit a DNA sample.

The defendant may not have any contact with Renee Polack or any property occupied by her.

The defendant may not consume or possess any alcohol or THC - even if he is in a jurisdiction where it is legal to do so.

The defendant may not enter into any bars, taverns or liquor stores.

timeConds.notes: To be completed within the first year of probation.

supervisions.notes:
Same conditions as Count #2 except no additional community service or fine.
Concurrent with: Count #2

Concurrent with: Counts #2 and #3

10:33 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph W Polack appeared by video, in custody from FOSO.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek appeared by video for Joseph W Polack. State - matter is resolved - joint recommendation - plead G to counts #2, #3, #4 and #6 deleting all repeater enhancers, counts #1 and #5 - DRI, count #2 - $500.00 fine plus costs - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years; count #3 - court costs only - no probation, counts #4 and #6 - court costs only - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years, conditions of probation to include: AODA and follow through with any recommendations, anger management assessment and follow through with any recommendations, must undergo a phycological evaluation and follow through with any/all treatment recommendations, no consumption or possession of alcohol, no entry into any bars, taverns or liquor stores, no consumption or possession of marijuana in any jurisdiction, FT employment/schooling, must take all medications in the manner in which they are prescribed, no contact with Renee Polack or any property occupied by her, 40 hours of community service. Svehlek and Polack agree. Court does waiver of right to appear in person today. Polack consents to appearing remotely today. State - has complied with victim notification requirements - nothing filed by victim. Court makes sure the defendant knows what it means for a count to be DRI. Court dismisses and reads in counts #1 and #5. Court amends counts #2, #3, #4 and #6 by removing all repeater allegations, domestic abuse enhancer follows counts #2, #3 and #4. Polack pleads G to counts #2, #3, #4 and #6 as amended by Court. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Svehlek makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - credit for 176 days only if revoked (stipulated). Polack makes brief statement, thanks his attorney. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #3 - court costs - 60 DTP/CO; counts #2, #4 and #6 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years - all concurrent to each other - with conditions of: count #2 - $500.00 fine plus costs - 60 DTP/CO, counts #4 and #5 - costs - 60 DTP/CO, additional conditions on all counts include AODA and follow through with any recommendations, anger management assessment and follow through with any recommendations - to be completed within the first 6 months, must undergo a phycological evaluation and follow through with any/all treatment recommendations - arrangements to be made within the first 90 days, no consumption or possession of alcohol, no entry into any bars, taverns or liquor stores, no consumption or possession of marijuana in any jurisdiction, FT employment/schooling, must take all medications in the manner in which they are prescribed, no contact with Renee Polack or any property occupied by her, 40 hours of community service - to be completed within the first year of probation, credit for 176 days only if revoked, submit DNA sample, right to appeal, defendant states he will be staying at Four Seasons Motel, adjourned.

Prior: 400 E Elm Street Apt 14, Crandon, WI 54520

2:21 PM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph W Polack appeared by video, in custody from FOSO.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek appeared by video for Joseph W Polack. State - here for PH and believe it is being waived - also makes mention that the Information is filed and does delete any repeater enhancer. Svehlek agrees. Court reviews Information. Curt has waiver of PH form (Svehlek just filed a few minutes ago), goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Svehlek has Information, will proceed to ARGN, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts plea, continues bond, set for JT.

10:20 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph W Polack appeared by video, in custody from FOSO.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek appeared by video for Joseph W Polack. Svehlek waives reading of complaint, requests PH but would like to be heard on bond prior to making decision to waive time limits. Svehlek - bond - ask for signature bond for stated reasons - if Court requests that the defendant stay in Forest County - he could reside at the homeless shelter in Crandon. State - bond - objects to a signature bond but would not object to a lower cash bond for stated reasons - at least $500.00. Court - bond  continues bond at this point for stated reasons - sets PH within time limits on 7/21/22 at 2:15 PM.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

09:32 AM Defendant Joseph W Polack appears by video from FC jail.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin by video. CC and CR appear by video. Polack has received a copy of the complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Polack understands. Court questions if he has contacted an attorney. Polack has not contacted an attorney. Court advises of options to obtain an attorney, SPD, private hire and if not eligible for SPD can petition the court for a court appointed attorney. Polak understands and will contact SPD. Court questions his address. Polack indicates he will be residing at the nearest homeless shelter. Court will continue bond and sets for AIA on March 16, 2022 at 9:00 AM.
